page.title: 13LUNAN BAY, TOURISM.
page.content: Thousands of visitors every year come to Lunan Bay. These are in the main day visitors,for the only residential accommodation is at the Lunan Bay hotel and the occasional holiday cottage to rent. There is no provision for caravans or camping though at times boy scouts have obtained permission from the farmer to camp in a field adjacent to the beach. The long sandy beach is ideal for children who also enjoy paddling in the gently shelving sea. Swimming in the sea is inadvisable due to the currents formed by the river Lunan entering the sea at this point. The sand dunes make ideal sun bathing and picnic spots.Recently a car park has been built close to the beach. Duck boards have also been put down over the sand dunes; this not only eases walking but also protects the dunes.
